result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Mazzara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony D. Mazzara is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony D. Mazzara was found guilty of Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(3m)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  No contact with C.D. or have anyone on defendant's behalf contact victim.   May not use Internet or computer without agent's consent.  Undergo any other counseling per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Upon successful completion of probation, costs paid in full, record may be expunged, 973.015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Expungement in 15CM251 only.  State gives joint recommendation.  Attorney Martinez agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statement reviewed.  C.D. makes statement to court.  State gives final statement.  Attorney Martinez makes final statement.   Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
24 months Probation, concurrent.
DNA surcharge sample
Expungement after completion of probation.
No contact with C.D.
May not use Internet or computer without agent's consent
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$243.00 costs & $200.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez requests all matters track to 7/30/2015 when there is a bond hearing set already.  Bond continued in all matters.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in custody.  Sue Mueller and intern Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Just got on the case yesterday.  Need more time.  Reset.  Return date scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Motion and Notice of Witness List

15R 011349
No contact w/C.D; prohibit from making any posts on the internet; Not to go to Baraboo library

Pre-trial conference at 06-19-2015 10:15 am.
Return date at 06-30-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Peter Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin and intern Rick Spoentgen.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500.00 cash bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $250.00 Cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/victim CD or prohibit from making any posts on the internet.  Not go to Baraboo public library to use the internet.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
